text:
Tasted from bottle side by side with Last Snow. Pours black with light tan head. Aroma is sweet bourbon, vanilla and just a hint of coconut. Mild to moderate bitterness with moderate sweetness. Flavors of bourbon, molasses, caramel, cocoa, vanilla, coconut. Just an incredible BA Porter. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Huge thanks Linus. Opaque black beer with a decent beige head. Chocolate and coconut aroma, raisins, slightly spicy with licorice notes. Clear and present coconut in the flavor, vanilla, licorice, raisins, spicy notes. A bit too heavy on the coconuts.
Bottle split two ways. Blackish pour with a small dark tan head. Notes of coconut, tons of coconut, light coffee, some light bell peppers, sweet vanilla and light caramel. Smooth!

UPDATED: MAY 30, 2017 Bottle thanks to Bursprak. Pours pitch black with a beige head. Aroma of coconut, coconut butter, chocolate, some coffee which is slight green and some slight sweet barrels that brings just a tiny little bit of smoke. Taste of spicy coffee, big coconut notes, roasted malts, coconut butter, vanilla, smooth bakers chocolate and some barrel notes.
Thanks dan. Dark brown black. Fudgey almond joy aroma. Sweet candy bar taste but not as artificial as the last snow.

22, capped. Thanks, R! Perfect way to bring the notes from the Florida Taste to a close. Pours an opaque dark mahogany with a dense and creamy dark tan head that goes away. Big sweet nose, but not cloying; well-balanced: coconut, chocolate, coffee, vanilla, oak, apricot, all working together. Sticky thick heavy body with moderate carb. Nice palate of dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, vanilla, apricot, and coconut. Harmonious and not as far over the top as a lot of these other FL impies. Whew. Mild earthy sweet chocolate finish.
Bottle shared thanks to Dan. Poured black with tan head. Aroma burnt char chestnut coconut. Light carb med bod. Taste light almond joy coconut.

Massive thanks to mariuspoenari for sharing this bottle! Black with medium tan head. There is massive coconut in my beer and I fucking love it. Dark roasted chocolate, mocha, coffee, insane amounts of coconut. Cocomilk, bourbon, vanilla, chocolate milk. Big sweet and moderate bitter. Full body, dense, thick, sweet, loaded with flavor. Crazy.

Bottle shared by Marius, thanks! Pours black with a tan head. Shit tons of coconut, cocoa, creamy decadent chocolate, milky, vanilla, bourbon, irish coffee. Like drinking a bounty bar. Amazing. Bit boozy but so pleasant. Heavy sweet, medium bitter. Over medium body, low carbonation.

Bottle shared massive thanks to Mariuspoenari! Black with bubbly light brown head. Loads of coconut, roasted coconut, chocolate, toffee, vanilla, quite sugary, cardamom, Pakistani sweets, light milky, sweet bourbon, spices, brandy, some alcohol. Very sweet with light boozy finish. Over medium bodied with slick feel. Very very nice, maybe not to drink a whole bottle of but Im really enjoying my glass here.

Bottle shared thanks to Marius. Black with a ring tan head. Aroma of massive, massive coconut, bounty bar, milk chocolate, toffee, vanilla, bourbon coming out, a beautiful box of milk chocolates. Flavour is heavy sweet. Full bodied with soft carbonation. Beautiful!

Bottle thanks to Homer!!! Pours inky black, medium creamy tan head, dissipates slowly, nice lacing. Aroma is loaded with coconut, vanilla, bourbon, marshmallow, milk chocolate. Flavor is medium plus sweet, light bitter, as it smells. Coffee present but taking a back seat to the other elements. Desert bomb. Mounds bar doused in a shot of bourbon. Medium plus body. Super decadent. Drink it. You may or may not like it, but you will remember it.

Refrigerated brown bomber poured into a cup. Black with small white head. Aroma is big coconut, medium body, lower carbonation, and some small-bubble lacing. Taste is coconut, chocolate, and some bourbon.

Poured from a 22 oz bottle. 
Aroma has moderate coconut and coffee notes. Light chocolate, nuts and roast. Medium light roast notes with some alcohol spice. 
Pours black with a small, thick, light tan head that recedes to the edges where it lingers. Light lacing and moderate legs. 
Flavor is somewhat sweet with chocolate, coffee and coconut notes. Some medium light roast notes. Moderate bitterness and medium light alcohol spice. 
Mouthfeel is medium full bodied and a bit oily with medium carbonation. Low astringency and medium low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a decent beer, but its a bit too nutty and roasty. The coconut and chocolate are nice, but the coffee is a bit strong. Needs to have a fuller mouthfeel as well.

Backlog, shared by a friend. Poured dark black with a tanned head. Nose is loaded with coconut, charred coconut, roasted malts, dark chcolate, coffee creamer, bourbon barrel adds a light smoothness and char notes, sweet caramel. The amount of "fake" coconut is so big its almost tasting artificial, not sure, i liked it but somehow i think their quality went down a little

On draft at Florida Cracker Kitchen Taproom. Pours a deep stout brown with a tan head. Nose is huge coconut, coconut oil, vanilla, coffee to the point of tartness, and cocoa with chocolate. Flavor is similar with cocoa, chocolate, coffee, coconut oil, coffee tartness, and some earthy oaky vanilla with some barrelchar. Flavor is an interesting balance that leans heavily toward coconut andcearthy coffee tartness. Light to medium in body and lingering coffee tartness with coconut into the finish.

Bouteille de 22 oz partagée entre amis. Arôme: Odeur de chocolat avec une pointe de vanille et de noix de coco. Apparence: La couleur est noire opaque. Présence dun mince col beige mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de chocolat et de noix de coco avec une pointe de vanille et de café. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Légère présence de vanille en arrière goût. (Rating #7536)
High hopes but came crashing down, original version was clearly better, cloying sweet and almost undrinkable more than a few ounces

Bottle at James. Pours a deep black with a thin tan head. Coconut with some pepper on the nose. Medium bodied,. roast and cocoa. Slow pepper with some chocolate and cocoa. Slow pepper and chocolate, coconut, mounds bars. Chocolate.

On tap at Lost and Found, pours an oily, viscous deep brown/black with legs and some swirling tan head. Nose has coconut, booze, bad bourbon, cherries, chocolate. Flavor is liquid Mounds bar with a shot of bourbon, heavy coconut. Full bodied, sticky finish. A treat.

Draft pour at Lost & Found. Poured a nearly pitch black color, maybe a very very dark shade of brown. Aroma was roasted malts, chocolate. Lots of rich roasted notes, with some coffee and dark chocolate.

Tap at lost and found. Pours black limited head and some lacing. Nose is coconut, chocolate. Flavours of coconut, chocolate, some coffee. Taste med bitter huge sweet. Full sticky body lively carbonation.

Really dark brown color with tan head. Aroma is like bourbon soaked toasted coconut. Tastes like coconut chocolate cake with some bourbon on top. Really nice fudge notes, well integrated flavors. Medium to full bodied, really smooth on the palate. Another great dessert beer from Funky Buddha.

Bottle shared at a tasting. Pitch black pour with a fine-grained tan head. Tons of toasted coconut notes, followed by roasted coffee, sweetened brewed coffee, bourbon barrel, vanilla and light oak notes. Very smooth texture, low carbonation. An absolute pleasure to drink.

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2017 Bottle. Moderate toasted, dark bread and dark chocolate for the malt, light herbs and resin for the hops, light to moderate dough for the yeast, with toffee and a load of coconut in the background. Head is small to average, creamy, tan, with some slippery lacing and good legs, and is mostly diminishing. Color is very dark brown. Flavor starts moderately sweet, then finishes moderately sweet and slightly bitter. Palate is full, creamy, with a soft carbonation and a lightly alcoholic finish. An excellent Imperial Porter and a fantastic drinking beer! So good, it?s gotta be good for you.

3/25/17. On tap at World of Beer, Destin. I picked the right weekend to land in Destin as WoB has some SICK Funky Buddha taps right now. FFS! Black pour with a nice tan head. Awesome aroma, whiskey apparent, barrel, coffee, coconut. Awesome flavor, coconut, white chocolate, coffee, chocolate, whiskey. Damn this is good.

Pours opaque coffee brown, light tan head. Aroma features coffee, roadt malt and caramel tones, very tempting. Flavor presents quality coffee, roast malt, chocolate and caramel notes, almost more stout than porter. Mouth feel offers good fizz and body. Bison, buffalo, whatever.

On tap at The Crafty Fox poured a clear dark reddish brown with a small lasting brown head. Aromas of dark chocolate, coconut, bourbon, coffee, light vanilla and light caramel. Palate was medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of dark chocolate, coconut, bourbon, coffee and light oak with a smooth lingering chocolate coconut finish.

Muitissimo parecida com a Last Snow com un toque inicialmente pequeno de bourbon que fica mais evidente com o tempo de copo. 
Totalmente negra turva, espuma marrom de boa formação e média persistência, cremosa. Aroma carregado de coco, em menor intensidade café e bourbon, muito convidativo. Paladar de dulçor intenso e médio amargor. Corpo licoroso e média carbonatação. Final mantém o coco em evidência misturado com o toque de bourbon, maltada, lembra a xarope de vanilla e café por último. Deliciosa.

From the bottle at EBF, 2/3/17.Large, light-tan head is very well-retained atop a cola-tinted, dark-mahogany body with good clarity.Coffee beans, spicy bourbon, espresso, vanilla and light fudge comprise the aromatic nose. Notably missing is any bit of alcohol/sharpness or overabundance of roast. I dont even get that much of the typical coconut/pina colada that most strong bourbon stouts exhibit. Light toastiness from the base oak, with just a touch of coconut but its folded in to the chocolate and coffee very nicely.In the mouth, youve got a very dry, wonderfully well-attenuated beer with engaging carbonation, tons of spicy coffee and spice, light barrel tannin and touches of warming coconut-like bourbon liquor. The chocolate-espresso from the malts perfectly balances everything without itself being overbearing. Vanilla, light bourbon, prune-raisin and more chocolate linger long. The finish is not dull and heavy from too much roast/sweetness/alcohol, but rather fruity, spicy and vibrant on account of how dry the beer is. Funky Buddha, it seems, can do no wrong.

Bottle @ RateBeer Best 2017 Bottle Share. Pours a black color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty chocolate coconut vanilla aroma. Roasted malty chocolate vanilla and coconut flavor. Has a roasted malty chocolate coconut vanilla finish.

From bottle shared at Ratebeer Best awards and bottle-share. Almost black color with beige head. Roasted malty aroma, chocolate, cocoa, light coffee, spicy, coconut, vanilla, light wood, light alcohol. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. n Medium to full silky oily body with soft carbonation.

22 oz bottle from Juan shared with Tmoney99 and the Nine Giant crew. Pours a dark cola brown color with a small beige head. The aroma has awesome coffee, coconut, light roast, vanilla, some sweet chocolate. The flavor has more of the same goodness, coconut, coffee light roast, sweet chocolate, light bourbon, dark fruits, cherry, tobacco, the finish has a character like when I used to chew on my grandfathers pipes in the 70s,very interesting and I am glad I had the chance to share/try this with others.

Bottle shared by alexsdad06. Poured a ruby black color with an average to large frothy tan head that lasted with excellent lacing. Moderate to heavy toasted chocolate malt, coffee and coconut aroma. Copious body with a creamy texture and flat carbonation. Medium to heavy toasted coconut sweet flavor with a smooth moderate to heavy dark sweet finish of moderate to long duration. STANDOUT!
Bottle. Black pour with tan head. Big bourbon aroma with coffee. Taste is a lot of coffee, vanilla, chocolate.
Pitch black with hints of coconut, vanilla and fresh roasted coffee. Great Bourbon barrel

[1/29/17] Bottle/Can/Crowler/Growler at the RateBeer award ceremony bottle share at Flamingo Hotel in Santa Rosa. Black. Wonderful aroma, coconut, vanilla, bourbon, chocolate, roast. Sweet. Full-bodied. Wonderful.

Bottle at EBF 2017. Even for Funky Buddha, this has a gargantuan amount of flavor. The coffee, chocolate, and especially the coconut really come through, making it taste almost like a coconut hot chocolate, and the bourbon barrel aging adds sweetness, complexity, vanilla, and a hint of booze. A heavenly assault on your palate.

Bottle courtesy of Biggsbowler. Creamy pitch black pour with a small creamy mocha head. Heavy roasty malt nose with plenty of roasted coconut. Dark chocolate, complex freshly ground coffee & bourbon alcohol. Sweet, bitter, malty & roasty taste. Soft, round, velvety & tiny boozy mouthfeel. Coffee coconut finish. Very heavy on the fresh aromatic coffee & coconut flavourings. Bitterness bugs me a little. While designed to be vulgar it seems too unbalanced. Snowed In came together in a way I liked more even if this is close to the same.

My Bottom Line:
Tons of coconut dominate this dessert brews vanilla, coffee and chocolate, as bourbon heat and slick residual sugars build a sturdy enough foundation to support the heavyset decadence.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A sheet of foam tops the blackness.
-Sunscreen allusions are quite hard to avoid.
-This doesnt smell anything like an Imperial Porter.
-This one has the body and wealth to support all the adjuncts, something I cant say about their Maple Bacon Coffee Porter or Last Snow.

Bottle.

February 11, 2017. Bottle, courtesy of _angst_ thanks! 
Black with a small brown head. Aroma is roasted coffee, some dark chocolate, lots of toasted coconuts, light barrel presence 
Taste is sweet malty, smooth roasted.
Finish is bitter roasted coffee with a light smooth berry presence, some dark chocolate notes, caramel, milk chocolate toasted coconut. 
Lots of coconuts and coffee, nice.

A: Deep dark brown coloured with a thin light brown lacing N: Toasted coconut, bourbon, vanilla, milk chocolate, coffee T: Coconut, coffee, milk chocolate, vanilla O: Very nice balanced! Lovely coconut to it!
Bottle. Pours pitch black with a small head. Aroma is huge coconut roasted malts coffee bourbon. Flavor is velvety lean slightly acidy charred coffee coconut chocolate... like a coffee Bounty.

From bottle, shared twoways thanks to Klimaet. Pours a pitch black with a big brown, fluffy head. Aroma has intense, fruity coconut, acidic coffee, green and orange Big Ben caramels, bourbon, bounty, nutty, white chocolate, dark chocolate, slight boozy. Taste is sweet and coconutty, light coffee acidity and some roasty bitterness and a smooth, nutty bourbon-ish finish. Nice and fluffy mouth feel and a creamy carbonation. Not as good as the Snowed In, but still really nice!

Bottle. Pours pitch black with a big frothy brown head. Aromas of coconut, caramel, fruity, coffee, vanilla, milk chocolate. Taste is chocolatey, roasty, bitter and slightly acidic coffee, coconut, coffee, dark fruits, caramel, vanilla, malty finish. Agreeably not as good as Snowed In but super delicious.

33cl Bottle @ Zombier, Malaga, Spain.
Black colour with a ligh tan head.
Aroma is coconut, vanilla, coffee, cocoa, brown sugar, bourbon, oak.
Taste is coconut, sweet, roasted malt, vanilla, bourbon.
Medium to full body, soft carbonation.
Lots of bourbon here but just under overdone like Bowie in his good moments. Black without any head. Roast, caramel and some coconut. Bittersweet and boozy finish. Tap at World of Beer in Miami.

Bottle @ Extreme Beer Fest, 4 Feb, 17. After a 20 minute wait in line, this poured a pitch black with a thin lasting tan head. Aroma is mild roastiness, thick chocolate, and good bourbon kick.
The flavor is has mild roasted back bone with a lighter side of medium body but still feel like a stout rather than a porter. Perfect amount of bourbon integrated throughout the sip, mild coconut, great lasting bourbon finish. Mild carbonation level. Awesome!

From notes. Bottle shared with ebone1988, Gus, and Aaron at Gus Birthday V2. Long time waiting on this one. 22 oz bottle. The pour is a dartker brown with a light brown colored cap of head that falls to a film. The aroma is delightful. The coconut and chocolate are huge up front. The coffee moves in after that and balances out with a light bourbon and a beautiful charred oak that offers the slightest hint of vanilla. This is fantastic. The flavor is much of the same. Chocolate and coconut flesh command the front end before the coffee and balance of bourbon and barrel move through on the finish. The mouth feel is a touch light and softly carbonated with a lingeringly chocolate and coconut finish. This is a wonderful beer.

Pours an opaque black from the bomber with thin ring of bubbly tan head that leaves light lace. Aroma is huge on the coconut with hints of vanilla and booze from the barrel. Taste is coffee, vanilla, mild barrel, and huge coconut, sweetness is tamed. Viscous, but not thick, really solid.

Shared bottle at RateBeer Best 2017. Pours black with a nice tan head. Aroma of chocolate, vanilla, coconut, and bourbon. Taste is chocolate, coconut, vanilla, roasted malt, bourbon, and some coffee. Very, very tasty.

Bottle pour at the RateBeer Best 2017 Grand Tasting/Bottle Share. Black with tan head. Aromas of coconut, vanilla, oak, dark chocolate. Tastes of coconut, dark chocolate, vanilla, oak. Medium-full body with a dry finish. Very tasty.

On tap at Chans Craft Bar in Destin. Great complex flavor-an almond joy dipped in some deep rich coffee spiked with a shot of Buffalo Trace bourbon. The flavors are distant without any one flavor dominating the taste. A great beer to savor.

Bottle at RB Awards. Pours black with medium tan head that diminishes to nothing. The aroma is strong coconut, roasted malt, chocolate, bourbon, wood. Thick body, roasted malt, coconut, vanilla, chocolate, boozy finish, really enjoyed this.

Pours an almost entirely black color with a fluffy, big, dark brown head.

Has a fantastic nose, full of roasted coconut, flowery, earthen coffee and a smack of toffee. Offers a hot chocolate quality with lots of melting cream in it, topped off by a slightly spicy, still floral barrel. Very convenient on the nose, with a prominent coconut-coffee interplay.

Drinks creamy soft with a sparkly hint to it, lighter mouthfeel, malty sweet and complex, due to the well integrated barrel and the adjuncts.

Tastes of toffee, earthy coffee with a roasted, dry hint to it, topped off by rock sugar. The barrel adds a warming note to the flavors, enhancing the already established coconut sweetness, together with a flowery note and a spicy bite. A prominent creaminess softens the barrel and brings out rock sugar even more, complimented by a wooden coffee dryness. Finishes with alcohol soaked pralines, fudge, maintaining coffee and a hint of toasty coconut, long and tasty.

Pretty tasty and well composed, apart from its thinner mouthfeel. The barrel itself acts as a link for the different adjuncts, smoothing out the different flavors very well.

Ratebeer Best bottle share. Pours dark brown with a nice tan head and a huge complex aroma that includes chocolate, treacle, coconut and coffee. The flavor is equally complex and very tasty with a warm alcohol trail. Belies the high ABV.
On roof patio at woodside with matt and Jacob. Thanks Jacob for bringing. Huge coconut nose, grease. Taste is maple, coconut. Mouthfeel is a little thin.
22oz bottle pours out black topped with a tan head. Nose is huge coconut coffee chocolate wow almond joy bourbon vanilla. Taste is as the nose with big coconut chocolate and bourbon.

Bottle shared with koleminer20, Gus, and Aaron for Gus Birthday Part 2. Aroma is coconut, chocolate, barrel, bourbon, coffee, roasted malt, amazing. Appearance is dark dark brown, light brown head, poured thickish. Taste is coconut, coffee, chocolate, bourbon, barrel, roasted malt, amazing. Mouthfeel is medium to heavy body, slightly oily, light carbonation, coconut barrel aftertaste. Overall, man this is great.

aroma: chocolate, coffee, roasty, vanilla, coconut 
appearance: .5 inch khaki head, creamy and pitch black
taste: huge coconut and chocolate flavors fallowed by coffee and a light bourbon finish
palate: medium body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish,
UPDATED: JAN 29, 2017 Pours dark brown with khaki lacing. Aroma is heavy coffee followed by coconut. The flavor is heavy breakfast diner coffee, coconut, somehow syrup and chocolate. Overlee sweet

UPDATED: JAN 27, 2017 Draft at the Brass Tap. Pours very dark brown with a creamy beige head. Tastes like rich chocolate syrup, coconut, smooth booze, woody malt, and light ash. Medium body and low/medium carbonation. Smells like coconut, vanilla, rich chocolate, woody malt, and smooth booze.

UPDATED: JAN 27, 2017 Tap. Pours deep, dark brown. Aroma is coconut, vanilla, oak, bourbon, chocolate, and some caramel. Flavor is big and boozy with huge bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, and coconut throughout with a dry oaky finish with a lot of spicy alcohol notes and warmth. Medium body.
Tap at Teak. Huge bourbon nose with coconut and chocolate aroma. Taste is medium body chocolate and bourbon. Sweet.

Bottle courtesy of Homer! Thanks Sean. Pours an inky dark brown, near black. Nice 2 finger brown colored head that fades to wispy lacing. Aromas are loaded with chocolate syrup, vanilla, toasted coconut, mild roast and mild oak/bourbon. Taste is incredibly balanced. Nice medium mouthfeel lends itself to the Mounds Bar parallel. Loads of chocolate covered coconut. Vanilla, bakers chocolate and a medium sweet cereal note hit mid-palate. Bitters and sweets in harmony with the barrel character very well integrated. Slight alcohol warmth makes its presence felt, but this finishes like a dream. Decadent, savory and way too easy to drink! Awesome beer.

Bomber. Dark brown with a thin light tan head thats pretty much a ring around the edge of the glass after a few seconds. Aroma is coconut and coffee. Strong coconut, a bit artificial, like Hawaiian tropic oil. Taste is coffee, chocolate and coconut. Rich like a desert. Mild bourbon and booze. Lingering coffee and chocolate.

22 oz. bottle shared by seeswo - thanks again, Chris! Pours a deep, dark, nearly opaque brown with slight amber highlights on the edges and a small tan head that settles into a lasting ring. So the coconut here is gigantic, as most others have mentioned. It surprised me to see it rated so high, even at this early juncture, given that coconut can be a polarizing ingredient. Supporting notes of coffee - which would be a pretty good dose if the coconut werent so forward - cocoa, caramel, toasted brown sugar, and mild warming bourbon throughout. Medium-full bodied, with modest carbonation and a sweet, mildly roasty, but mostly sweet mouthfeel. It has an almost oily texture, but that couldve just been my mind playing with me after one friend winced and said, "Whoa, sun tan lotion!" Hes not entirely wrong, but still, I liked this one a lot for the most part.
Bottle thanks to Russel. Pours black with a light tan head. Coconut and oak barrel nose. Medium mouthfeel, very coconut forward flavor that goes through the Long sweet finish.

UPDATED: JAN 13, 2017 Thanks Zack for sharing the bottle! Poured into a taster showing inky black and translucent coffee rims. 

The nose shows a strong mix of coconut and vanilla. 

The palate is full bodied and lightly carbonated. Flavors of intense coconut and vanilla on a light bed of roasted malts and coffee. Tropical yet with an ice cream like edge with a minty mouthfeel.

Bottle shared by Zack. Thanks man. Happy NYE!

Dark brown body with a thin cap that fades to nil. Aromas of coconut, chocolate, bourbon, oak, roast, char. Similar flavor. Almond Joy candy bars. Medium bodied with light sweetness, balanced by roast and char characters.

On tap at Maple Bacon Day. Served in a plastic cup. Originally reviewed 1/10/2015.
Black. Nice khaki head good retention. Looks sticky. 

Lots of coconut in the smell. Sweet caramel. Coffee. Chocolate. Some bourbon, but light.

Barrel shows more in the flavor. Nice whiskey flavor. Coffee and coconut in equal portions. Some oak. Slightly sharp oak. Lots of lactose sweetness in the back end.
Very sweet. Medium heavy. Slightly acidic woody flavor.
This is really excellent. Not quite Morning Wood, but its much better than Snowed In.
So good. It is a mounds bar in a glass. Just an amazing brew from the team at Funky.
Dark black pour. Holy shit. This is good. Serious liquid mounds bar. Rich chocolate, coconut and perfect barreling. Seriously a gem.

On tap at the Buddha. Dark brown pour with a mocha head. Sweet caramel and bourbon aromas. Loads of booze with sweet caramels, chocolate, vanilla, and oak notes. A bit thin in the body with a good mouthfeel.

EBF. Pours a deep black with no head and no lacing. It looks "rich". Nose is of coffee, slight smoke and coconut. Light on the bourbon flavors but I can appreciate that. Taste is of coffee, coconut, chocolate and lightly sweet. Again, this is not a bourbon-bomb and thats fine. Body is medium-full, carbonation moderate. Mouthfeel is thick and dessert-like. Overall a really solid imperial stout and something Id go for again! Best FB brew so far!

ample @ EBF 2015. very dark brown pour with a small crema cap, nice lacing sticking. dense chocolate and burnt hazelnuts, loads of sweet toasted coconut - touch of banana shake, vanilla, touch of resin, warming alcohol - slightly boozy, wood, some sweetness - maple syrup and rum demerara. low carbonation, medium to full body - oily and sticky; warming and spicy-woody finish. big and tasty. very good stuff!

EBF.
Pours brown with very low to no brown head. Aroma is of coconut, vanilla, fruits, malt, butterscotch. Taste is of vanilla, coconut, caramel, molasses, brown sugar. Palate: Full bodied, soft carbonation. Overall: Very good. A fine sipper.

Sample @ EBF.

Appearance: Pitch black with a small bubbly brown head and not much lacing but some alcohol legs.

Aroma: Incredibly decadent! Burst of coconut along bourbon, nuts, lots of chocolate, roasted malt, caramel, super rich malts, oak and vanilla. Wow, so rich and complex!

Taste: Almost as amazing as the aroma. Sweet, but not cloying. Burst of coconut again with bourbon, rich caramel malts, chocolate, biscuity, roasted presence, oak, caramel, vanilla and light bitterness.

Palate: Full body. Soft carbonation. Oily. Massively flavorful finish with a very nice warming (not burning) presence. Coconut - chocolate and roasted malt aftertaste. 

Overall: Extremely flavorful and complex. Favorite beer of EBF. A lot of similarities with Proprietors 14. I love these coconut forward barrel aged RIS.

Sample at EBF. Oily black pour, no head. Aroma is super rich, tons of coconut, rich caramel, chocolate, bourbon vanilla. Taste is super sweet, really desserty, coconut, Tom says this was like Prop 14 but I disgress, prop 14 was a cinnamon bomb. This is all about vanilla and coconut, milk chocolate flavor. Palate is rich but not too boozy, very slick and oily, palate coating. Very nice.

From MBCP release on draft - Pour dark brown w/ creamy white head. The nose is bourbon, coconut, white chocolate, and vanilla. The taste is creamy and smooth w/ hints of coconut and white chocolate plus bourbon. Very well balanced. I could drink a few more of these beers.

Draft at EBF. Black pour with brown head. Aroma is wow.... Rich mounds bar. Dark chocolate, roasted coconut, bourbon barrel, vanilla, caramel.. Taste is a samoa girl scout cookie soaked in bourbon. So ridiculously good. No adjuncts no ragrets. Wheres the beer... I dont care.
UPDATED: JUN 2, 2017 Bottle. Pours black tan head. Nose/taste of coconut, light bourbon, roast chocolate, oaky vanilla. Medium body.
Sample at EBF. Pours nearly black with no head. Aroma is amazing- chocolate, fresh coconut, brown sugar, bourbon. Taste is sweet, coconut, liquid mounds bar. Smooth Bourbon and oak in the finish.
Draft at ebf. Dark pour with some head. Coconut, chocolate, vanilla and bourbon aromas. Chocolate, vanilla and coconut; hints of bourbon and oak.

Sample pour at fl brewers guild craft beer day 2015. This is by and far the best BA stout that I have ever had. The taste is as described above, but what really stood out for me was just how smoothly the bourbon rounded the coconut out in the beer.

Had this at Maple Bacon Fest 15 and it was the nightcap. Just WoW.. If you have ever had Last Snow or Snowed In you must try this barrel aged version the Smokey Whiskey flavor is the perfect addition to this beer. If you are lucky enough to be around when they showcase this beer it is a must have.

Fudge colored pour, tan head. Nose is whiskey, vanilla, coconut, fudge. Taste is the same, sweet but far from cloying, everything melded together seamlessly. Chewy creamy mouthfeel. Man this was good.

Draft at MBCP Day 2015. This is the one that did it for me this day. Just wow! Initially a soft vanilla booziness in the nose followed by coconut and chocolate. Taste is a mix of boozy spirit and coconut; the barrel aging seems to have mellowed out the coconut, which I find to make it more pleasant. a slightly sweet but never cloying mouthfeel. This is a barrel aged Mounds candy bar. Absolutely delicious way to end the day!
